description: Numbers of n-digit primes that undulate.
comments: 'Undulate' means that the alternate digits are consistently greater than or less than the digits adjacent to them (e.g. 70769). Smoothly undulating palindromic primes (e.g. 95959) are a subset and included in the count.
references: C. A. Pickover, "Wonders of Numbers", Oxford New York 2001, Chapter 52, pp. 123-124, 316-317.
links: C. A. Pickover, "Wonders of Numbers, Adventures in Mathematics, Mind and Meaning," Zentralblatt review
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Undulating Number.
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Sep 15 2000.
extensions: Offset corrected and a(10)-a(11) from _Donovan Johnson_, Aug 08 2010
